pullRequest.body:
Let `f : X ‚ü∂ S` and `g : Y ‚ü∂ S` be morphisms of schemes. In this PR we describe the underlying
topological space of `pullback f g`, i.e. the fiber product `X √ó[S] Y`. In particular, we show that the points of `X √ó[S] Y` correspond bijectively to pairs `(z, p)` of triples `z = (x, y, s)` with `f x = s = g y` and prime ideals `q` of `Œ∫(x) ‚äó[Œ∫(s)] Œ∫(y)`.

From the valuative criterion project.

Co-authored-by: Qi Ge
Co-authored-by: Andrew Yang

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->
- [x] depends on: #15240
- [x] depends on: #17768 
- [x] depends on: #18255

:v: chrisflav can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks for the reviews!

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11682971863/job/32531216023)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11682971863/job/32531216313)
LGTM
LGTM but I also contributed a significant portion of this.
LGTM
I don't think these should be in `Algebra/Category`.
These should not exist at all now that we have faithfully flat modules, updated.

```suggestion
lemma specTensorTo_base_fst (p : Spec T.tensor) :
```

```suggestion
lemma specTensorTo_base_snd (p : Spec T.tensor) :
```

```suggestion
The points of the underlying topological space of `X √ó[S] Y` bijectively correspond to
```

```suggestion
- `AlgebraicGeometry.Scheme.Pullback.carrierEquiv`: The bijective correspondence between the points
```

I would prefer that (explicit) arguments of `def`s are given explicitly, not via variables, if they are not too long. It is much more readable. 

(i.e. I usually put the `variable` statement *after* the def that needs it.)
I'm slightly sad that this doesn't have a more descriptive name, but `Base` is all I can think of, which is no better.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry/Pullback): description of the underlying topological space of a fiber product of schemes
